msbt.message: Gardening's never been my hobby of choice—I have a history with slugs— but I'm intrigued by Leif's shrubs. The selling point is they grow flowers that only bloom at certain times.They're like the pop-up events of plant life.
Have you bought any seeds from Leif yet? He's got a few that are particularly rare, . Poppin' a few of those in the ground would really freshen up 's image.

Want the latest scoop from the gardening world, ?If you water flowers every day, you just may be rewarded with a rare-colored blossom! It's like the earth's giving you a homemade thank-you gift, but, you know, classier.

Happy Nature Day! I hope you're celebrating appropriately. Planting flowers, recycling cans Secretly hoping you'll meet Mother Nature herself and score a once-in a-lifetime autograph. You know, the usual.

Normally I like to be at the center of attention, but on Nature Day, nature is the true star of the show. Take a minute to appreciate the trees that provide food and shadethe beautiful flowers that brighten our daysand even those persistent weeds we just can't stop.
